title-part.text: SUNGLASSES OR GOGGLES INSOFAR AS THEY HAVE THE SAME FEATURES AS SPECTACLES

reference.text: trial frames for testing the eyes A61B3/04; goggles or eyeshields not having the same features as spectacles A61F9/00

note.note-paragraph: This subclass also covers monocles, pince-nez or lorgnettes.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Assemblies of lenses with bridges or browbars
Bridge or browbar secured to lenses without the use of rims

CPC-specific-text.text: with lenses secured to the fixing parts by clamping, luting, soldering, gluing without holes or recesses in the lenses
with auxiliary bars

title-part.text: Bridge or browbar secured to or integral with partial rims, e.g. with partially-flexible rim for holding lens
Bridge or browbar secured to or integral with closed rigid rims for the lenses
the rims being tranversely split and provided with securing means

CPC-specific-text.text: Special mounting grooves in the rim or on the lens

title-part.text: Special supporting arrangements for lens assemblies or monocles

reference.text: lenses therefor G02C7/00; by walking-sticks A45B3/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangements for fitting and securing to the head in the position of use
Arrangements for fitting and securing to the head or neck not in the position of use

title-part.text: Arrangements for supporting by hand, e.g. lorgnette, Arrangements for supporting by articles

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for particular purposes, not otherwise provided for or not fully classifiable according to technical characteristics, e.g. therapeutic glasses
Shooting or aiming glasses
Glasses allowing access to one eye, e.g. for make-up application
Collapsible frames
Spectacles frames characterized by their material, material structure and material properties
for varying the horizontal distance of the lenses

title-part.text: Intermediate bars or bars between bridge and side-members
Nose-engaging surfaces of bridges or rims

CPC-specific-text.text: with adjustable means
for vertically varying the position of the lenses
exchangeable or otherwise fitted to the shape of the nose
Pince-nez
having special ear pieces
having special front end
Pivot bearings and hinge bolts other than screws
Resilient hinges
comprising a fixed hinge member and a coil spring
comprising a sliding hinge member and a coil spring
comprising a sliding box containing a spring
comprising elastic means other than coil spring
Composite hinges, e.g. for varying the inclination of the lenses
Hinges without well-defined pivot axis
Special hinge screws
Oblique hinge axis
; Methods of designing lenses
with pattern for identification or with cosmetic or therapeutic effects

reference.text: methods and processes take preference, e.g. printing, marking or copying processes B41M; identification in general G09F3/00; producing decorative effects in general B44C; surface treatment of glass C03C15/00 - C03C23/00; positioning or marking of lenses B24B13/0055

CPC-specific-text.text: Ophthalmic lenses having special refractive features achieved by special materials or material structures
Methods of designing ophthalmic lenses
considering parameters of the viewed object
considering wearer's parameters
Special mathematical design techniques

reference.text: disinfection or sterilisation of contact lenses A61L12/00

CPC-specific-text.text: bifocal; multifocal
Simultaneous type
Translating type
Annular configuration, e.g. pupil tuned
Sectorial configuration
Contact lenses having an iris pattern
Contact lens fitting; Contact lenses for orthokeratology; Contact lenses for specially shaped corneae
Means for stabilising the orientation of lenses in the eye
Contact lenses having special fitting or structural features achieved by special materials or material structures
; progressive
Spectacle lenses with progressively varying focal power
Shape of the progressive surface
Properties on the principal line
Shape, location or size of the viewing zones
Special properties achieved by the combination of the front and back surfaces
Ophthalmic lenses with variable focal length
Electrooptic lenses
Fluid-filled lenses, e.g. electro-wetting lenses
Auxiliary lenses located directly on a main spectacle lens or in the immediate vicinity of main spectacles
Lens systems mounted to spectacles

title-part.text: Filters, e.g. for facilitating adaptation of the eyes to the dark

CPC-specific-text.text: having an electro-optical light valve
Photochromic filters
having spectral characteristics for purposes other than sun-protection
having inhomogeneously distributed colouring
Interference colour filters
Colouring materials

title-part.text: Obturators, e.g. with pinhole, with slot

title-part.text: by fitting over or clamping on

disinfection or sterilisation of contact lenses A61L12/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Assembling; Repairing
Measuring during assembly or fitting of spectacles
Measuring geometric parameters required to locate ophtalmic lenses in spectacles frames

reference.text: apparatus for testing or instruments for examining the eyes per se A61B3/00; machines or devices and accessories for grinding the edges of lenses using spectacles as a template B24B9/144

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices specially adapted for cleaning spectacles frame or lenses
Devices specially adapted for cleaning contact lenses

title-part.text: Generic mechanical aspects applicable to one or more of the groups G02C1/00 - G02C5/00 and G02C9/00 - G02C13/00 and their subgroups
Junctions between frame elements having a click function
Modular frames, easily exchangeable frame parts and lenses
Frame or frame portions made from wire
Frame or frame portions made from sheet type material
Frame or frame portions made from rubber
Generic optical aspects applicable to one or more of the subgroups of G02C7/00
Mislocation tolerant lenses or lens systems
Optical elements and systems for visual disorders other than refractive errors, low vision
Locally varying refractive index, gradient index lenses
Diffractive and Fresnel lenses or lens portions
Correction of higher order and chromatic aberrations, wave front measurement and calculation
